text: I'm trying to write a post-mortem about a weekend client issue caused by A. them changing their external IP and not telling us, and B. not updating their DNS on the url pointing to that IP.
I have no idea what to say about how on my side we can prevent this from happening again
You can write a script to flood ping their external address and then send you a mail notice when it goes away...
:wink:
"clearly communicate to clients the importance of keep us in the loop with IP updates"

You joke but I continous ping running on a box to a small client because the ipsec tunnel between us is configured wrong on their firewall and if it drops due to lack of traffic it won't pick back up unless they get in and manually drop the connection.
:face_with_rolling_eyes:

That's not a six week temp thing either, it's been doing that for three years or so. I hit them up every so often and ask if they've looked at it and they say it's on the list and then I never hear anything back
It's a dynamic IP address but they aren't using dynamic dns for it?
I think their public-facing address assigned to incoming traffic changed, and they have some web server in that firewall DMZ we hit via a url
So when that firewall public IP changed the URL we hit stopped working
But they won't fix it on their end...
They didn't realize it was on their end all weekend
They just kept pointing at us and saying it must be us blocking their new IP or something
That of course came after like six hours of them not telling us their public IP had changed in the first place.
Is he actually this oblivious?
Yes
Yup
or he wanted some more activity on his feed
Unreal
"I don't have anything to talk about so here's a non issue!"
Never mind the whole "you bitch about fetches so we're just not shuffling anything ever" that they openly said
Also, earlier today he said "I don't think Balance counts as a removal spell"
I need somewhere to vent about this, it's driving me crazy how popular this fucking dunce is
Go
Be free
I mean, that's all I got for now
Ha, I thought we were in for more
Never mind
Obviously Balance is a ramp spell
What can I say that can't be said for the fact that he just admitted he doesn't pay attention or comprehend anything he reads
Balance is a counterspell
Balance obviously is card draw in white
Technically you drew Balance so that math checks out
I thought Balance was a construct of Thanos?
That's the other Balance.
Thanos plays a casual deck of 36 balances.
Balance is an efficient card filter.
Balance is a tempo card
Float six, sacc lands to zuran orb, balance always felt great back in the day
i just dropped a scuba tank on my toe and had to have surgery. that was my exciting day

Your jobs involve a weird degree of injury, dude. Bit by a python, falling scuba tanks... one of these days you’ll be like “Hey a zebra headbutted me into a stack of pianos” and it will be completely normal
i mean, i got 15 bee stings on my leg at one point this summer. y'all just didnt hear bout it cuz it didnt impact my writing haha
but yeah, ive had a LOT of injury
<https://twitter.com/AEMarling/status/1039276928392253441>

text: This fussing about losing so bad to a bad match up is so silly. Heaven forbid a new deck comes in and you have a 70/30 matchup...
They're called "unfair" decks for a reason
Didn’t we need to ban Death’s Shadow a little while ago?
Allegedly
You decided to play Modern. Ya takes yer lumps.
Precisely
I hate that it basically boils down to a more nuanced "git gud" argument...but it does.
Either sideboard aggressively like you are or...maybe work towards playing a different deck?
I mean it’s a strong deck so you have to sideboard accordingly.
Which means your sideboard will be less good against most other decks.

When someone like Sir Marling is so glued to a deck like he is I have a very hard time believing he doesn't have to collection to audible to something with a better KCI matchup if that's what he's going to get all Marcel about the game with
Yup.
It’s a true Cinderella story.
The whole "burn is great until you play against a deck that doesn't care about burn" anecdote holds true
I stopped following him.
Awhile ago.
